meanings.sent1: The group cartelises to control the market.
meanings.sent2: She cartelises with other businesses to fix prices.
meanings.sent3: The animals cartelises to demand more treats from the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: The students cartelises to protest against homework assignments.
meanings.sent5: The team cartelises to strategize their next move in the game.

meanings.definition: cartelises: cartelises (third-person singular simple present cartelises, present participle cartelising, simple past and past participle cartelised)
meanings.sent1: He cartelises the industry to gain more power.
meanings.sent2: The company cartelises its products for higher profits.
meanings.sent3: The chef cartelises the ingredients to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: Her smile cartelises the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The music cartelises the crowd into a dancing frenzy.
